node.excerpt: If all were like; nigh black and white, Lone to thine eye; such a vile sight, Look alive for change in the tide, Learned so not to swallow…
Cometh what may, I'll win the day, Amid the fray, My sword gives sway, I need not pray, Heed what doubts say, I find a way, And here I'll…
Named after the ancient Angles, Formed by bloody wars and struggles, Soldiers and knights laid down their lives, Through all England ever…
